comment._content: It could have been my grand-grandmother! She wore the same clothes when I was a child.

comment.author: 36823892@N05
comment._content: Beautiful photograph ; such a great costume :-))

comment.author: 60890355@N05
comment._content: The phrase "aw, your Dutch" has taken on a whole new meaning.

comment.author: 23667928@N02
comment._content:
She is a Protestant women from 'Zuid Beveladn, an area in the province Zeeland in the Netherlands.
You can see by the shape of her headwear from wich area she came from and what church she belongs to. Catholic women wore diffrent caps.

comment.author: 65108116@N07
comment._content: What are the metal pins called at the side of the cap? They are positioned differently than Catholic caps

comment.author: 23667928@N02
comment._content: I believe they were called 'stikken' and they were worn diffrently from Catholic woman, that's true. There is also a difrerence in what the wore during the week and on days the did not work. The fabric on weekdays was less colorfull. When a woman became a widdow, she only wore blacks and greys for the rest of her life.

comment.author: 65108116@N07
comment._content: Thank you so much! It's really interesting
